The Smart Campus Attendance and Safety System (SCASS) is an Android-based solution designed to automate classroom attendance using real-time face recognition and to enhance campus safety with quick alert and incident-reporting features. SCASS replaces manual roll calls and paper-based sheets with a fast, secure, and fraud-proof attendance system that identifies students directly through the camera. The system uses modern mobile technologies such as CameraX, ML Kit face detection, and on-device TensorFlow Lite models to ensure accurate recognition even on mid-range devices.
Attendance records are stored locally and synchronized with a cloud backend, making the system reliable both online and offline. SCASS also integrates safety tools, allowing students to send instant panic alerts or report incidents from within the app. These features provide a unified, mobile-driven solution that supports instructors, administrators, and students.
By reducing manual workload, eliminating proxy attendance, and ensuring timely safety reporting, SCASS aims to modernize campus operations and create a more secure and efficient academic environment.
